Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; buff slip; exterior: at junction with neck, band of short black and added red tongues; below, chain of large palmettes with red and black petals and spreading volutes between dilute lines; below, band of dots.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 85, no. 11, pl. VI, no. 11)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 248, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.041)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
